items.title: Pages Directory
items.summary: A file-based routing to create routes within your web application using Vue Router (https://router.vuejs.org/) under the hood. Usage Pages are Vue components and can have any va...
items.content_html:
A file-based routing to create routes within your web application using [Vue Router](https://router.vuejs.org/) under the hood.

Usage

Pages are Vue components and can have any valid extension that Nuxt supports (by default .vue, .js, .jsx, .mjs, .ts or .tsx). Nuxt will automatically create a route for every page in your ~/pages/ directory.

The pages/index.vue file will be mapped to the / route of your application.

If you are using app.vue, make sure to use the <NuxtPage/> component to display the current page:

Pages must have a single root element to allow route transitions between pages. (HTML comments are considered elements as well.)

This means that when the route is server-rendered, or statically generated, you will be able to see its contents correctly, but when you navigate towards that route during client-side navigation the transition between routes will fail and you'll see that the route will not be rendered.

Here are some examples to illustrate what a page with a single root element looks like:

You can use the NuxtLink tool to navigate between pages

items.title: Paginations
items.summary: If you have too much data to display in one page, use pagination. Basic usage Set layout with different pagination elements you wish to display separated with a comma. Paginatio...
items.content_html:
If you have too much data to display in one page, use pagination.

Basic usage

Set layout with different pagination elements you wish to display separated with a comma. Pagination elements are: prev (a button navigating to the previous page), next (a button navigating to the next page), pager (page list), jumper (a jump-to input), total (total item count), size (a select to determine page size) and ->(every element after this symbol will be pulled to the right).

items.summary: Besides the native features of img, support lazy load, custom placeholder and load failure, etc. Basic Usage Indicate how the image should be resized to fit its container by fit...
items.content_html:
Besides the native features of img, support lazy load, custom placeholder and load failure, etc.

Basic Usage

Indicate how the image should be resized to fit its container by fit, same as native object-fit.

items.title: Date Picker
items.summary: Use format to control displayed text's format in the input box. Use value-format to control binding value's format. By default, the component accepts and emits a Date object. Ch...
items.content_html:
Use `format` to control displayed text's `format` in the input box. Use `value-format` to control binding value's format.

By default, the component accepts and emits a Date object.

Check the list here of all available formats of Day.js.

Note

Pay attention to capitalization

items.title: Number
items.summary: Input numerical values with a customizable range. Basic usage Bind a variable to v-model in element and you are set. When inputting invalid string to the input box, input value ...
items.content_html:
Input numerical values with a customizable range.

Basic usage

Bind a variable to v-model in <el-input-number> element and you are set.

Tips

When inputting invalid string to the input box, input value will emit NaN to the upper layer as result of error

items.title: Select
items.summary: When there are plenty of options, use a drop-down menu to display and select desired ones. This component requires the wrap when used in SSR (eg: Nuxt (https://nuxt.com/v3)) and...
items.content_html:
When there are plenty of options, use a drop-down menu to display and select desired ones.

Tips

This component requires the <client-only></client-only> wrap when used in SSR (eg: Nuxt) and SSG (eg: VitePress).

Basic usage

v-model is the value of el-option that is currently selected.

items.content_html:
Drag the slider within a fixed range.

Basic usage

The current value is displayed when the slider is being dragged.

Customize the initial value of the slider by setting the binding value.

items.title: Switch
items.summary: Switch is used for switching between two opposing states. Basic usage Bind v-model to a Boolean typed variable. The --el-switch-on-color and --el-switch-off-color CSS variables ...
items.content_html:
Switch is used for switching between two opposing states.

Basic usage

Bind v-model to a Boolean typed variable. The --el-switch-on-color and --el-switch-off-color CSS variables decides the background color in two states.
